intro: Cissus mildbraedii, commonly known as the African grapevine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by red, berry-like fruits. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Cissus mildbraedii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas.
